w:r.w:t: The teacher will the months and days by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December, Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wedn
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for months and days
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: days, months, his, her

Put the months in order starting with January. Write a number one by January to show that it is first. Write a number two by February to show it is second. Continue the pattern.
Say all the months in order: January, February, March, April,
May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December. Have the child join in two more times.
Then write a number one by January. Ask the child, “Where should we put the number two?” Prompt the child as needed.
